Not even a three year old would like this. This film is loaded with stupid jokes, gross out scenes, horrible CGI, bad acting, and who was the makeup genius on this film? When Jim Carey put the mask on he was a lot cooler than Jamie Kennedy's mask persona. When Jamie puts on the mask, he looks like a rejected Joker toy made for the Batman franchise. I dare give this film a one even though it begs for a zero, but I must admit I enjoyed one scene in this wreckage, even though the film was tragic. I liked Ben Steins sequence at the start of the film in the museum explaining to people who brought the mask to life and what not. And from there the film rolls down hill like a boulder. Bad, bad, bad!The original mask, while not perfect, was a good film till this came along! This film totally destroys the original. So I must warn you, avoid at all risks!

reviews.review_title: A Disturbing display of unfunny jokes, hideous aesthetic quality and shocking overall delivery.
reviews.content: I know a lot of people don't like sequels. Some say they endanger the first film by maybe disgracing it, others say they're just a cash in. Sometimes filmmakers get it right (Terminator 2: Judgement Day) but other times, they get it wrong. Son of the Mask is a great example of an instance when they do just that. Son of the Mask has to be one of the worst sequels of all time and even though the first Mask film was no classic, it had its moments and I truly mean that. What Son of the Mask is, is nothing more than a nasty to look at, nasty to watch, mess of bad and unfunny jokes mixed in with horrible music and nasty to look at visuals.From the off, Son of the Mask begins its terrible decent into celluloid waste. It messes around, very dangerously, with the original Mask film's premise. We are told that Loki: the Nordic God of mischief, created the mask in question and banished it himself to Earth for people to find, fool around with and create mischief of their own. It's Loki's job in this film to find it, by rule of Odin, so that he can get back into Valhalla or wherever. This immediately goes against the first film as we were told Loki was, in fact, BANISHED from his heaven and imprisoned inside this mask that was then placed on the earth; hopefully for no one to ever find. Thus, destroying the equilibrium. This is the first mistake the film makes of many and if you can't even get your equilibriums right, you're in big trouble.First of all; the characters. Loki in this film is evil. He is genuinely evil and it spoils the image that was created in the first film when he was a mischievous, funny, maybe misunderstood God. In Son of the Mask, he acts as the villain of the piece and that is very disorientating, especially if you've seen the first film and I had a big problem with this. Then we move onto the supposed hero. The hero is Tim Avery (Kennedy) a comic book artist who lacks big inspiration. The fact he has one of the most annoying voices I've ever heard in a film and acts like a twelve year old throughout is enough to utterly repel you from any sort of feeling or relation towards him. These are bad principals for a hero to have. Thirdly, when we actually see our hero wear the mask; its not only a let down as so much as a shockingly unfunny and downright embarrassing series of events that I've ever witnessed in a film.The scene in question is the company he works for and their large function they're having. There's no build up like their was in the first film, there's no motivation to even wear the mask and our hero's position in Son of the Mask isn't as desperate as Ipkiss' was in the first film. Anyway, once the mask goes on; we're treated to an absolutely hideous display of camera work including close ups of the ugly Mask character's face, fast editing as we struggle to grasp what it is we're seeing, music so bad you have to cover your ears and dance numbers so cringe-worthingly bad that it hurts to watch.Then comes the plot. The plot is straight forward enough as I've explained. Loki's trying to find his mask that he supposedly created. What happens is Loki spends so much time going from house to house trying to find his Mask that I, personally, began to stop caring. Each visit was just an excuse to 'do something funny' and with jokes so blatantly aimed at children; it was difficult to watch. Another thing is the pointless, 'in there for laughs' subplot that opens up. This involves the baby that's born that is given the powers of the mask. Halfway through the child seems it fit to copy various cartoons on the TV to try and get their father (who's the hero) condemned to a mental institute. This is bad enough as the writers aren't even using their own initiative to create material. To counteract this, the family's dog attempts to defy the baby. Although maybe funny the first time this quickly plays out into utter farce and serves no bearing on the rest of the film; it's just a pointless mess of jokes and gags that makes you feel like you're watching an episode of Road Runner vs. Wile E. Coyote. During this, for some reason the father doesn't actually think of perhaps filming the baby or something like that rather than pick him up and run to the neighbour's house; thus trying to convince them the baby can sing and dance. Oh look, it's stopped: what a surprise.Plot holes? You bet. Loki has his powers taken away from him and is made mortal during a scrap in an alley way; yet survives the baby's counterattack of having two rubbish skips crush him. He's, literally, just been made mortal yet survives being crushed. Another instance is nearer the end when Avery's Mask character does battle with Loki over the child. Loki states 'Stop! We are evenly matched!' Well, of course you are! The guy's wearing your mask; he has your powers. It took them about ten minutes to figure that out(!) I also really feel that although the acting talent it has on display, if they'd have known it was going to be anything like how it was, they would've kept well away. With these things and a few hundred plot holes heaped on top, Son of the Mask can easily be labelled as one of the worst films ever made; in fact it makes 'The Mask' look like a masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: " You can Ip-kiss your ass goodbye".
reviews.content: The original Mask film was about a guy named Stanley Ipkiss who was a bank teller. He found a mask that turned him into somebody's else. He even had Cameron Diaz hitting on him. 11 years pass by, and they decide to make a sequel. Called Son of the Mask. I was excited to see it because I loved the original film. My smile immediately faded. Son of the Mask is an absolutely terrible film. The worst Jim Carrey-less sequel. Or, just to say the least, the worst sequel ever made. The film has a decent cast(Besides Jamie Kennedy) including Alan Cumming. That's it. It has an unbearable length of 94 minutes... which isn't even a long time. Son of the Mask is probably the hugest waste of time ever. When Jamie Kennedy puts on the mask, you want to scream. You wanted to do that when you saw Dorian in the first film, but Kennedy's is a lot worse. Son of the Mask is a film that just tanks, tanks tanks tanks. so it's obvious that I give this film a big big big thumbs down. Son of the Mask is the biggest waste of time ever. It's one of the worst ever. so you should know by now that you can ip-kiss this movie's ass goodbye.

reviews.review_title: Well, it was "free", and I've seen a few worse.
reviews.content: This is roughly a sequel to the excellent 1994 movie with Jim Carrey. Here Loki's dad, a mythical god, is angry because Loki lost his mask. Loki (Alan Cumming) is sent to find it. We open with a scene in a museum where droll docent Dr. Neuman (Ben Stein) is explaining to everyone how Loki's mask can give the wearer power, when Loki himself shows up. But it turns out this mask is just a good Asian-made replica, so Loki's hunt is on.The central family here is the Avery family, aspiring cartoonist Tim (Jamie Kennedy) and his wife Tonya (cute Traylor Howard, looking much younger than her 38 years) who desperately wants to start a family, but Tim isn't ready yet.SPOILERS FOLLOW. One night Tim has to find something to wear to a work-related costume party, so quickly grabs the old mask that the family dog had brought home from a nearby creek. When he put the mask on, he became a different person, was the life of the party, and when he got home to his wife apparently made unbridled, passionate love. Because she immediately became pregnant. Nine months later baby Alvey (played by twins) was born. But as a son of Loki, sort of, he was not your ordinary baby, able at an early age to say words and do strange things with his body parts. Somehow Loki figures out his "mask baby" was born on a certain date, gets the list of newborns, and one by one tries to find his.Much of the movie contains so much silliness that it is worthless to describe, much of it when mom was out of town on business for a week. Suffice to say, in the end baby Alvey helps mom and dad get the upper hand on Loki, and Tim becomes the very successful author and illustrator of a popular animated TV show, about the antics of a family's dog and baby (modeled after his own).

reviews.review_title: Not THAT bad
reviews.content: I sort of liked this movie, not a good one, but not the worst ever made. Though, everyone else says it is one o the worst movies ever created, I thought it was okay. There are a lot of immature jokes. It wants to be funny sometimes, but fails.The story is OKAY. It may be a little hard to follow for the younger audiences, though.The acting is pretty bad. Jamie Kennedy is a horrible actor at most times. At some times, it is even laughable. Alan Cumming is probably the best actor in here. He is funny when he is supposed to be, but some of his lines are god awful.Oh, and the main bad thing about this movie that I hated was Tim Avery's voice when he is possessed by the mask. The voice is HORRIBLE. Also, the scenes that he is in are so unfunny, that they are almost unbearable. I am sure they could have cut him out, and it wouldn't affect the movie at all.Overall, you can live without seeing this. It is a nice movie to watch if you have nothing else to watch, though. They definitely could have gone without making the sequel, but it is a decent effort. 4/10

reviews.review_title: This is a good movie...
reviews.content: for me to poop on! If I had it my way, my review would stop there, but IMDb requires a minimum of ten lines of text for all user comments. Since I have nothing else to really say about the movie, I made a list of things that I'd rather do than watch this crap again. 1. Take a bath with my Christmas lights. 2. Drink lemonade... after chewing on a razor. 3. Attempt to domesticate a badger. 4. Do "YMCA" on the karaoke machine at the local biker bar. 5. Hug a tree.............. a flesh eating grizzly tree. That being said, I can only hope and pray that the makers of this film have resigned and devoted their lives to rehabilitating all the unfortunate souls that were tainted by this filth.

reviews.review_title: Cheap Knockoff
reviews.content: The main actor and actress were clearly just bargain bin versions of Jim Carrey and Cameron Diaz. The portrayal of the original Mask could only be performed by someone with the physical comedy chops of Carrey - the voice, impressions, physical comedy and most importantly facial movements.The animation honestly could have been worse, but still was horrifying at times. In theory the plot could have worked well, but the limits of and over-reliance on CGI made it hard to connect to anything going on.I gave an extra point for the creators wringing every last drop out of the dog actor they used for the movie. That thing does a million different tricks.

reviews.review_title: Not a Jim Carrey classic, but hilarious nonetheless
reviews.content: I just finished this movie and my cheeks hurt from the grinning. Son of the Mask expands on the story of Jim Carrey classic The Mask in a whole different way. A baby is conceived while the father is wearing the titular mask and 9 months later unto the world is born a nightmare child with cartoon god-like powers. On top of this, the pet dog, now jealous of the baby getting all the attention, has gotten its paws on the mask and become a green-faced, revenge-seeking cartoon mutt.Meanwhile, Loki, the fabled God of mischief (mentioned in the original movie, not featured), has been instructed by his father Odin to retrieve his mask due to the havoc it caused in the first film. Loki is the essence of the Mask and thus can also turn green and do the Jim Carrey routine, coming to a total of four equally bizarre Mask-like characters, though obviously none living up to Jim Carrey.The father, and hero of the movie is played by Jamie Kennedy, the funny chap who was the film buff in the Scream movies ("Did you put her liver in the mailbox? Because I read that the killer put her liver in the mailbox..."), and he does a good job. Upon donning the mask he becomes the plastic-haired, catsuit-clad, cheesy game show host type (nice to see more different takes on what the mask does to different people) who is amusing though feels a little unnatural compared to the his acting in "Dad form".Plenty of great CG just like the original, some spectacular visuals and designs, and for a movie so different to it's predecessor and so much more family friendly, it certainly does a good job of recreating the original atmosphere with nice lighting and settings.So, would I recommend it? If you're a hardcore fan of The Mask in the form of comic book, movie or even cartoon, probably not, because it's not what you will want from a sequel. For slightly more open-minded people looking for some fun and a few smiles of nostalgia from nods to the original, totally. It's a side-splitter, particularly for kids.There's no obligation to have seen the original; it works as a film on it's own as well as a sequel, so don't worry if you want to entertain your very young kids but don't want to expose them to some of the more "PG" humour of the original. Then perhaps they can check the original out when they're a few years older.Underrated and great fun. It may not be the "Revenge of the Mask" movie we were promised all those years ago and it's not a masterpiece by any means (what sequel is?) but it's really nice to see a clever and creative sequel/followup to a film whose chances as a franchise we all thought were dead.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as the critics say,but still one of the dumbest movies I've ever seen
reviews.content: For the first time I lay my eyes on the cover of this film,I could tell that it was going one of the pointless movies ever made.So I was right.For the first few minutes of the film I found myself asking "these questions:"The first movie was good enough,why make a second?""Are personally trying to make people want to hate this movie?" AND...Why did you add a stupid baby in it?"Seriously.The acting was kinda lousy,the directing and story was completely worthless,the special effects were okay i admit,a little too comically done for my taste,but overall the whole film was sort of all over the place.I mean okay.It had it cute moments,but like I said.Why would some idiot make a dumb sequel out of a very loved movie?

reviews.review_title: Really bad,too far fetched.
reviews.content: Son of the mask is a really bad movie,the storyline is exxagerrated poorly and the actors in it can barely act at all,theirs a lot of reasons why this is on IMDBs bottom 100 (number 62).The mask of Loki gets its hands into a cartoonist called Tim Avery ,whose new son gets the mask powers,the newborn boy and Tim Averys jealous dog don't get along and when the dog tries the mask on he tries to get rid of the baby.*/*****1/5 STARS-1/10

reviews.review_title: Not all that bad
reviews.content: I didn't know what I wasn't getting myself into: usually, I am not too fond of sequels. And this one didn't disappoint me either. If you are looking for the same quality movie as the original The Mask with Jim Carrey, then skip this selection altogether. I am not saying that without Jim the movie is not the same... Actually, that's exactly what I am saying: no Jim = no hilarity, no falling off your chair funny, no uniqueness. However, if you decide to have a movie that knows its limitations (and the loss of its major attraction), then the sequel isn't half that bad. Writing could have been better (a lot of information is given for granted, so you have to fill in using your own brain), but overall the plot holds together. Acting is not bad, and Jamie Kennedy is trying his best. I think he tries to follow Jim, and sometimes he succeeds. The final conclusion: this movie is NOT as bad as it could have been.

reviews.review_title: Time-filler nothing more
reviews.content: I saw the movie this past weekend. It's something of a paradox since all the effort in making this movie went into the special effects. The story such as it is, finds a man unwilling to raise his son, who was conceived while the father wore the mask. All the gags seem to be stolen from that putrid "Meet the Parents" sequel. It lasts about 98 minutes, and its pace is frenetic and boring at the same time. Way too much juvenile humor. Since there's so little dialogue, the actors are left floundering. The original was no masterpiece, but it had some endearing moments; specially towards the beginning. Here, there's an elaborate explanation about the origin of the Mask by the god Loki, and then it's forgotten and never fully explained as to why it's a big deal for him to get his mask back.

reviews.review_title: Parents - You've Seen Worse
reviews.content: I peek around here from time to time for a good laugh when I know a bad movie is trying to see the light of day. As an adult I've enjoyed reading all the comments for this movie. Now for the confession, I did see a screening of this movie with my children and...THEY seemed to enjoy it. Plot is simple, the colors and animation were just enough to capture their attention. Definitely not something I would recommend to my single friends but other parents shouldn't panic if their 9 year old wants to see this one. Movie goes by pretty quick and you'll laugh at least once. Keep in mind I'm rating it 6/10 in comparison to other kid movies not comedy.

reviews.review_title: Why?
reviews.content: There was no need for this movie, plain and simple. The original, although hated by some, was something I found to be actually really entertaining, mainly because it was before Jim Carrey started to really lose his touch, and Cameron Diaz was, well, "Smoooooookin!" 'Nuff said. So why make a sequel/prequel thing? Honestly? Knowing that Jim Carrey wouldn't do it should've been clue enough that it didn't deserve to be created. But then they just make mistake after mistake. Jamie Kennedy. Why is this man still allowed to breathe? The writing and story: terrible. Why would I ever want to see a baby wearing the mask? Moreover why would I want to see it fly? Ever? HOW DID SOMEONE THINK THIS WAS A GOOD IDEA?! The acting is despicable, in fact nearly everything about this movie is. I'm trying to keep calm, or IMDb probably won't let me post this. Bottom line: don't watch this piece of trash. Pick up the original, see how good Cameron Diaz looked and how Jim Carrey used to have a career, and laugh. Don't waste even a second of your time on this.

reviews.review_title: This Movie Was Horrible
reviews.content: THis Movie was absolutely dreadful. The effects were very low budget. There was no good acting, nor did the plot make any since. I seen this movie yesterday and i actually have no idea why the writers, actors,etc. wasted there time on writing such an ironic,pointless,and stupid movie! This movie proves that people will write the most ironic movies just to consume your time and earn money! I strongly suggest that no one over the age of 4 go see this movie! I my self hated this movie and if i could i'd get a refund. This movie should only cost 50 cents for people to see it because thats apparently how much money they spent on making it!

reviews.review_title: Worst film of the century.
reviews.content: Well I had the chance to view this film the other day. I didn't know what to expect as I never saw the trailer and such... but what I did discover simply by watching the first 10 minutes is that this film is the worst I have ever had the misfortune to see.I wish I could give it this film a 0 rating. The first 10 minutes were bad but as soon as it goto the party scene I wanted to just enter a coma it was really poorly done. The actors didn't have any direction, there was no real story, I read some reviews that state its good if you have a little child to entertain for 90 minutes etc... but really why should we expose children to this type of film? Its got poor humor, rude and crude comedy at best and focuses on poor special effects to fill 80% of its time. I am sure a few people in Hollywood will be out on the streets after this film bombs.Also How can 39 people give this movie a 10. I mean get real anyone that gives this movie a 10 either has some mental issue and or works for the film company. This movie should average at 1.5/10 instead of its current 2.3/10 due to the people that ranked it 10. Truly sad.

reviews.review_title: What were they ssssssssmokin'?
reviews.content: If ever you wanted to see an episode of Tom and Jerry done completely in CGI, this is the closest you'll get.I sneaked into this movie simply to see how bad it truly was, considering there hasn't been a positive thing said about it that I've heard so far. I wasn't at all surprised to find that all of the negative sentiments in regards to this movie were not unjustified.I sat through the entire screening, and during that time I saw at least two people walk out of the theater. When the ending finally came I came to realize that those who did walk out had the right idea.Save your money to see a decent movie, and let this be a lesson to New Line: stick to making good movies like The Lord of the Rings. Your studio should be sitting pretty as a result of its success, so you have no reason to be reinventing old Jim Carrey flicks. They just don't work!

reviews.review_title: FUNNY AND ENTERTAINING
reviews.content: Come on I saw this when I was 8 and I rewatched again to see if I hated it after all these years I mean come on guys you guys r Giving this a 2 outta 10 realllly everyone who hated this movie must really not like Jamie I'm Jim's spot.

reviews.review_title: Instead of being a sequel, it's more of a horrible sequel with no Jim Carrey or any funny moment in sight.
reviews.content: Back in the 90's, we were given a film called, "The Mask", it was a really funny movie with Jim Carrey and got some positive feedback.In 2005, we were given the sequel, "Son of the Mask". All I have to say is this, "THIS IS ONE OF THE WORST FILMS EVER MADE!!".Not only it's a terrible sequel, but it ended up being one of the worst films ever made. I can give you three reasons why: 1. It was unfunny. REALLY UNFUNNY.2. It was like a cartoon show that goes on for a half hour and has tons of CGI. Do we need that much CGI? 3. Jim Carrey wasn't in the film. Instead, Jamie Kennedy. Serously? Jamie Kennedy does a horrible job as his character. Along with the rest of the cast. Except for Ben Stein.These were three reasons why this movie was terrible. Whatever you do, do not watch this movie. I repeat, DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE.

reviews.review_title: Yep. It was pretty bad.
reviews.content: So, this was made in place of The Mask 2, huh? Well all I can say is that I feel sorry for the poor folks who took part in that Nintendo Power contest, because this being the sequel, I couldn't think of anyone who would take this awful flick as a prize for anything. Even when I was i kid, I didn't like it that much. Every time I was at the movie rental store, I'd always choose the original version. This is just a good example on how bad sequels can really be, It's dumb, creepy, obnoxious, and makes your eye sting. This has got to be one of the biggest regrets I have in life, All that i'm thankful for is there isn't gonna be a 3rd one. Oh crap... I might've jinxed it, didn't I?

reviews.review_title: Pure Crap
reviews.content: It's crap from start to finish, it's got Jimmy Kennedy in it, can't say I am surprised.What a surprise, a sequel to a not so great movie end up being crappy as well. No, it gets better, take away the big name actors and put in shotie story to boot.How do you get worse from a really mediocre movie?Get a sequel, in the case of Mask. Wait, we don't we make a sequel to "It's Pat".I don't know what the studio is thinking?That's the kind of greed that needs to be punished.These studios just think they can pull a fast one, sucker enough people to recover their cost and move on. What a load of turd.

reviews.review_title: It's not THAT bad - COME ON!!!
reviews.content: I've seen a lot of movies that deserve IMDb's bottom 100 - this is not one of them.If you're wanting a movie like THE MASK, then watch THE MASK.This is cute, clean fun. The special effects were done very well and it had a cute story line. I don't think it was intended to be a blockbuster hit, but it's certainly something I would watch again.I did find it lacking for the first few minutes, but keep watching, it gets better.I watched the deleted scenes on the DVD and felt that some of them should have been left in the film.But all in all, it's a good family film. I think it's worth the watch.
Meh. Rly disaster. However it wasn't the worst what I've seen so 3 is kind of good for this film.

reviews.review_title: Probably one of the worst sequels (and movies) ever.
reviews.content: In 1994, the Mask was released and made good use of computer effects, which were new at the time, had some good slapstick humor, and made a lot of money. After this there were talks about the Mask 2, there was even a Nintendo Power ad for it with a contest where you could be an extra in the movie! However that was canceled and then in 2005, we got Son of the Mask. It had a horrible plot, creepy and over the top computer effects, and the movie's overall just plain stupid. Plus, almost none of the original actors returned in this movie. Son of the Mask is just an awful excuse for a more family-friendly Mask sequel, and should be avoided at all costs.

reviews.review_title: Weak sequel
reviews.content: Sure, I could easily write quite a bit as to the many things wrong with this film. I will first point out it's good points. There are three goods things about this movie. The first Alan Cumming as Loki, the god of mischief, was very unique and I actually thought there was some funny material there. I enjoyed his antics alright. The second is Ben Stein. I've always found Ben Stein to be pretty funny and his brief appearance here in the opening made the film look more promising than it ended up being. The last thing is Jamie Kennedy. Although I've criticized his comedy in the past, I will always have a soft spot in my heart for him. While he doesn't do as good a job as Jim Carrey in the film before, he is very charismatic and seems to put more effort into making his material work, so I give plus points for effort. However, this film is terrible. The special effects have no charm and no mystery. We aren't left sitting in the seats wondering how they pulled off one special effect or another. We all can tell that it's just a bunch of CGI images. And that's the least of this film's problems. What really bothered me was the baby. The baby was creepy and did very wrong and horrible things that babies shouldn't do. Things only went from bad to worse when the dog got a hold of the mask. There was this horrific and psychotically freaky subplot in which the dog tries to kill the baby for no reason. What the hell?! This was some scary stuff. I don't recommend it, especially not to children.Pros: -Alan Cumming -Ben Stein -Jamie Kennedy Cons: -Everything that wasn't Alan Cumming, Ben Stein, or Jamie Kennedy

reviews.review_title: Awful doesn't even come close
reviews.content: I would have voted "zero", but it wasn't an option. This movie was so bad that at the 2/3 point of the movie, I got up and walked out. If I thought there was a chance of getting my money back, I would have tried. The resemblance between this movie and the original are only fleeting at best. Following the birth of the "Mask-enhanced baby", the movie quickly becomes a souped-up version of a "Wile E. Coyote/Road Runner" cartoon, just not as funny. The baby and the "Mask-enhanced dog" spend the entire movie trying to take the other one out. Basically, this movie stinks on ice. I don't recommend anybody watch this movie in the theatre or on DVD. Save your money, please! Go and rent some Looney Tunes and get some real laughs.

reviews.review_title: Don't Blame Australia
reviews.content: Just read that in the commentary on the DVD for this excrement that the producers and indeed the main "actor" (the word is used here loosely) blamed Australia for it's "lack of actors with convincing US accents" and the "Difficulties it encountered trying to make Sydney look like LA".Look here you stupid a holes, THIS IS Australia. If you wanted it to look and sound like LA, FILM IT IN LA.Also, don't try to pin this travesty on anyone else. This is about as funny as finding out you are terminally ill, and that your wife was killed on the way to the hospital by a drunk driver who turned out to be your son, who you gave a bottle of bourbon and the keys to the car to.

reviews.review_title: Worth watching more than once
reviews.content: "Son of the Mask" is fast moving, almost funny movie. It has a good cast and a lot of imagination. Maybe it's more weird than funny but it's never boring. It plays like a kids movie with a nice amount of kiddie gross-out humor. I think my daughters would have gotten a kick out of this movie when they were little. "Son of the Mask" is a pretty good movie that deserves a revisit every once in a while.

reviews.review_title: It's trite, unfunny and I don't like it. Who does?
reviews.content: My Take: Inspired from a cartoon but captures none of its charm and glee. Instead, it's just an annoying waste of time. There was particularly one scene that manage to entertain me in this pointless excuse for a movie. That would be the Halloween party scene. I know it's corny, I think so too, but I do like the song, but if you found other movies with that song, please share it, cause I wouldn't want to go over this "movie" again. It's trite, unfunny and I don't like it. Who does? I hardly can recall the first film, but rest to sure, that would be at least better than this one. The producers had to waste all the money they had on (silly) effects, that they couldn't even afford some good and funny talent or even a good script with, at least, some humor. Jamie Kennedy boast his "funny" persona, but he really doesn't make a person burst out laughing or at least show a grin. The story is just a mix up, rushed due to their over emphasis on the effects, which don't turn out to be that special either.But even though I hate it, I still couldn't look away for most parts. So here's a word of warning: Once you see this, run!!! Rating: 1/2 out of 5.

reviews.review_title: Its the best flick I have seen all year
reviews.content: its kids movie, but I love it. I saw the movie and really loved the acting of Jamie Kennedy, Alan Cumming was wonderful as the evil Loki. The special effect were the best! The dog Otis is so cute!! What can you say bad about this movie? It has all the elements of a kid flick. GO SEE IT!!! its fun! I saw it at the Grove in Los Angeles and I was invited to the Premier and the after party, which was 100% kid land! From the bumping music to the wonderful food it was for kids. What else for a kid type movie? Jamie Kennedy give the most cute and comical expressions. There is a part in the movie where you can tell Jamie Kennedy does his own thing, its the fish mouth. Go see it, its a feel good movie hugs.

reviews.review_title: Give us a break. I saw this movie and thought it was cute.
reviews.content: I just read the comments for this movie and can tell some of you just like to cut anything down. I saw the "Mask" and did think it very good and have watched several times. I also saw the "Son of the Mask" and seemed to enjoy watching this as well. Some would say I'm sappy but I did think it cute. I did feel this was setup for a totally different age group than the first. I was surprised at first but feel I was at least open minded not like some of the comments here. "And no I am not a writer, producer, or anything else attached to this movie." I liked the setup for Loki, and how the mask got here was explained very well. Ben Stein played his part so well that it made for a great beginning. They did lose me for a while in the intro of the beloved dog and the baby, this I thought was weak. The party sequence was good up until the western part which dragged. I thought that sometimes the director got lost because there where times when the story skipped a beat. I loved Loki as a character. The dog and baby was great laughs. The father could have been a stronger character than it was. All in all it seemed to me to be setup to explain how the mask got here, and if you didn't go in with a mind set first. I think you would have a great time with this movie. I have friends out side of this country that say the movie is much funnier than the one in the states. That there where parts cut out of this movie for the rating. I LIKED IT. THE STORY WAS CUTE. Try seeing it with out the expectation and you may think so too!

reviews.review_title: Annoying and NOT Entertaining
reviews.content: This is by far the worst movie I have ever seen. The movie drags on to say the least. I'm not sure why I sat through the entire movie, but all I wanted it to do was end. Not only is this movie not entertaining, but the plot was anxiety producing. The poor guy who was supposed to take care of his baby is basically psychologically tortured the entire movie. Another thing that really annoyed about this movie is the scene where the mask character dances. In the original movie this scene is hilarious. This movie tries to recreate that and fails miserably. The only thing I can do at this point is to tell you to NEVER, I repeat, NEVER watch this movie. It's just going to get you angry and make you want to smash your T.V.

reviews.review_title: makes 'Batman and Robin" look good
reviews.content: Let me start of by saying I loved The original Mask. It had a great cast, good humor, and decent special effects. So when I heard they were making a sequel, I was very excited, but also wary( Movie sequels have a history of disappointing me). So on the Night it came out, I rushed over to the nearest theater, bought a ticket, and got ready for a night full of excitement. boy, was I disappointed! The plot is about Norse god Loki trying to get the mask back, or else his father, Odin will take away his powers(or something like that) Anyway, Some Cartoonist who doesn't want to become a father finds the mask, and takes it to a costume party. If you liked the CGI antics of the first film, Sorry to disappoint: The Party scene is one of the few times when someone even uses the mask, and it's not that great. Soon the cartoonist(still wearing the mask) goes home, and apparently he forgot about his reluctance to become a father, because... well, you know what I mean. Soon a baby is born(with super powers from the mask), and he and the dog (did I mention they have a dog too?) are competing for attention. Meanwhile Loki tries to find the baby for a reason too stupid to write. This is pretty much what the rest of the movie is about. I am not making this up. eventually, Loki loses his powers because he couldn't find the baby, but gets his powers back for an hour and finds the baby, which he uses as black mail for the mask. the cartoonist puts on his mask in an attempt to defeat Loki, But realizes they are equally matched. then Odin appears and is mad at Loki and is about to Banish him, When Cartoonist tells Odin that nothing's more important then family. Again, I am not making this up. He gives Loki the mask, And everyone goes home. Roll credits. this movie was so Unoriginal and badly written it relied on several Looney Tune Plots, Including "One Froggy Evening"(the one where this one guy finds a singing frog, But whenever he shows it to people, the frog just sits there, doing nothing) Avoid this movie at all costs. You will want your hour and 20 minuted back. I sure did.

reviews.review_title: What The Heck!!
reviews.content: This movie is not right for religious people, The baddie just smacked the god on the face!! and the dog was wearing the mask and started acting like a psycho and wanted to kill the lunatic baby that wants his father to go to jail. That movie is like that almost all the characters are retarded. The bad guy wanted to kill the baby and the residents are not paying any attention to that and just walk past them like they don't even care! It was supposed to be funny but actually it too much, everyone will just lift their top lip up all the way. Plus this scares my 7 year old child because there's too many cartoon guns and the dogs eyes fell out of his body. This movie cannot have more than one stars!

reviews.review_title: Haven't seen it, but here's the deal...
reviews.content: I know a good amount of Norse mythology. I haven't seen this movie but if what I've heard is true, I'm pretty mad already.1~ Loki is not FUNNY, people. Nor would he be able to come back as he did in this movie. He sorta died in Ragnarok; after he released himself from a rock the Gods had tied him to (with the entrails of his dead son) and released Fenris to EAT everybody. 2~ Odin is the "Allfather", but not LOKI'S FATHER. 3~ By all accounts of the skalds and what not, Loki had red hair and was evil looking, not some tripped out club kid with spiky black hair. 4~ He wanted to make trouble with Odin. He sort of destroyed him and his entire kingdom because he hated him to the point of death. You don't visit Hel, queen of the underworld to be ordered around to find some ridiculous mask, especially when you're willing to kill Odin's son on top of everything else.There's a hundred more points surely, but I don't have the time. Norse mythology is a big part of my beliefs and this film (which I've not yet rated due to my not- and probably never will- seeing it) is like trying to convince a Christian that a movie about Jesus dancing on the cross would be a funny thing.

reviews.review_title: Sugar Honey Ice Tea
reviews.content: About as good as knocking one out with sand paper.Peppa pig is more exciting than this sugar honey ice tea!

reviews.review_title: No one's sure what they're doing!
reviews.content: For a 2005 movie, the animation's pretty good at places and there's a part of history they want you to know. Across the movie, cloggy mind of the film makers or a very different audience as targets, they fail to deliver the context or the content required to please the Critics.This was all that was there in the movie, The Mask was quite a popular TV Animation Series in many areas of the world but they messed it all up. The good thing is that it has got some catchy actups that can attract the children and especially babies as you well know they love colours and gestures which they take as actions.The movie has the relations of a newly made father and son compared to another father-son pair that's messed up and the Family of the Mask, the Dog, Loki, ( and Thor) and the Gods are creamed up in between.Better make sure that one has the movie's playing time as completely useless to invest the time to watch this. No pun intended.

reviews.review_title: This movie is a son of something, but definitely not "The Mask".
reviews.content:
It's hard to learn a sequel because only other people have worked on it. But that does not have to mean anything if just a few funny effects a funny story and the movie is passable.
This is all except passable(As the Nostalgia Critic had said)
This is not only one of the worst sequels with some of the most terrifying nightmare-indexing images that this movie not only lists the worst sequels but also the worst movies ever.
It is so ugly, so badly done, that alone by calling the title in most viewers post-traumatic stress disorders can be triggered.It's loud, it's disgusting, it's not funny, it does not make sense + it has some of the worst CGI effects in history. These visual abominations are so intricate in such a reckless and disagreeable story that it is absolutely frightening that people actually dared to publish it as a "family movie".
It's nonstop annoying, non-stop idiotic, non-stop terrifying.Every moment of this film is a test of endurance that asks how much of your senses we can attack before you hate all humanity.

reviews.review_title: Possibly the worst movie ever made
reviews.content: "Son of the Mask" is a terrible excuse of a movie. I went to see this with my friend and I still wish we had seen "Because of Winn-Dixie" instead. I must say that it is partially my fault, as I agreed to go see it with him. Being a fan of the first "Mask" movie (Jim Carrey was hilarious) I had hoped it wasn't as bad as all of the critics said it was.Ten minutes into the movie I knew it was headed for disaster. Disgusting and pointless attempts at being funny got little seven and eight year old children shrieking with laughter, but the rest of us were left staring at the screen in disbelief.Finding the movie as repulsive and unfunny as I did is surprising to even me, as I loved "Scary Movie" and "Anchorman", two films which many people I know found crude and offensive. But the thing is, "Son of the Mask" is not funny unless you're under the age of ten.The film features lots of CGI in it, but it cannot save this piece of rubbish. Whoever allowed this movie to make it to the big screen was probably thinking it had potential, considering the success of its original. Unfortunately, it has none of the laughs, fun, or excitement of the first, creating a mockery of the original movie. I recommend renting the original "Mask" to anyone who is thinking about seeing this one. 1 star out of 10 is generous to this awful mess.

reviews.review_title: disaster...I'd shout if IMDb would let me...
reviews.content: I think the director spent way more time talking to the Production Designer than the actors. Everyone looked like they were embarrassed to appear in this mess.Oh, and I think the director wants to be an animator. It reeks of Fresh-Out-Of-CalArts. Hope the paychecks didn't bounce.Jaime Kennedy shows he absolutely has no talent. Traylor Howard's cute but we see about 0.75 seconds of her legs. Alan Cummings' career continues to swirl into the sewer and Kal Penn should be ashamed of himself. He was fabulous in Harold & Kumar, but I think the "director" told him to do an Indian accent. Why, I don't know. The sets are ridiculous and the photography colorfully murky. No redeeming features whatsoever. Stay very far away.

reviews.review_title: Waste of Time & Money
reviews.content: It's been quite a while since I wrote my original review of 'Son of the Mask,' and I must say, I have matured some. My opinion, however, has not changed. 'Son of the Mask' sucks. I didn't like the original, and I especially despise this sequel. It's a cheap way for the filmmakers to make a quick buck. I'm not sure I'll ever be able to think of Jamie Kennedy positively again. And poor Alan Cumming. I liked him in 'X2: X-Men United," but here he's an embarrassment. The only thing the sequel has in common is the cursed Mask in the center of the story. Nothing else. I assure you you'll not see Stanley Ipkiss through the entire film. Sorry.The movie has a few funny moments; Ben Stein's guest performance seems to be the only positive part of the film. What the filmmakers don't get here is the fact that kids aren't automatically gonna laugh when they see Jamie Kennedy being tossed around by a psychotic, possessed baby. They'll just be disturbed and confused...just like you will be.Please, please, I beg of you, don't think this movie is 'cute' and buy it. Briskly walk away from that aisle when you see this movie. Watching it is a painful experience.1.5/4

reviews.review_title: Hilarious!
reviews.content: I say that just because of how bad it was. The only salvation for this movie was the fact that the woman who played the guy's wife was super cute! Alan Cumming and Bob Hoskins are great actors! Bob Hoskins did great portraying Odin, though Alan screwed up Loki, and the ending was ridiculously lame...Also ridiculous was how this movie felt NOTHING like the original Mask at all. For one, the Mask itself was rarely used--only twice by the main character (Jamie Kennedy), and then by the dog for most of the rest of the movie, while the poorly CGed baby ran around while the dog tried to kill it, in a lame Looney Tunes style ripoff.It also completely eradicated the mystery and stylish suspense of the Mask by making it a creation of a very gay and modernized Norse god Loki, and cartoonizing practically the entire movie.I think they were trying to recreate Jim Carrey and Cameron Diaz's characters with the two new characters---not in name, but just in presence. Kennedy has a JackRusselTerrier dog, just like Stanley Ipkiss has Milo, and both females are blonde. That's pretty much it, but w/e. The girl was fun to look at (*gawks at the pretty girl*) and the brief crackly lesson in Norse mythology in the beginning was mildly entertaining

reviews.review_title: Makes children cry
reviews.content: I took my niece to see this yesterday. My brother now owes me larger than he ever has before. Not only this the movie follow no rational chain of thought or logical progression, not only did no character behave according to the rules we thought the movie had provided, not only is there no connection to the original Mask, save in name alone, but the kid actually cried through half of it. Not bawled, that would have been sweet reprieve, and I'd have had to leave, just cried, usually because she thought the doggie was going to be evil again. She didn't understand, and neither did I. I gave this movie a 2/10, but only because I'm reserving my 1/10 for something worse to come along. I was able to think of things that would have made it worse, and I liked Alan Cumming's hair.

reviews.review_title: I knew everyone says its awful but i was still surprised by how awful!
reviews.content: Wow!I have just finished watching Son of the mask and having heard not one good word about it i still didn't expect what i just watched. I thought everyone was being hard on it due to the fact that its another sequel to a Jim Carey movie without Jim Carey (like dumb and dumberer which isn't all bad). This is truly a very bad film, script, direction (i can see a very short career there!) and the acting. Although to give them a break most of the actors do try but the editing and direction just doesn't do anything to assist them. I got this for an 8 year old who saw the trailer with the dog in the mask (they love dogs) and they haven't seen it yet....I'm going to have to take them and buy a flippin dog after showing them this due to the disappointment i can see coming! Awful and truly deserves to be in the 100 worst movies!

reviews.review_title: The horror the horror
reviews.content: My god to sit through this horrendous abomination and stay sane is impossible. The this movie is so evil that the devil himself dares not speak of it. Do not watch this movie it or let your kids see it. "A Family Picture" my ass. The CGI is god awful and so out of place that it will make Ride to Hell's sex scenes look natural. The jokes are abysmal. AVOID THIS Movie AT ALL COST.

reviews.review_title: Hands down, the worst movie I hsve ever seen
reviews.content: In your head imagine the Arnold Schwarzenegger baby from Junior. Now put that on constant repeat for 90 mins. That's this film. A complete and utter raping of the eyes.

reviews.review_title: How can there be a movie, The Mask, without Jim Carrey ?
reviews.content: First of all, the title, Son of the Mask, itself put me off ! Who the hell is this son ? While the original Mask was brilliant, with Cameron Diaz's debut, Carrey at his wacky best, this one is no where near it ! In the original, there were those beautifully choreographed numbers, that cute little doggy, naughty, yet helpful, Carrey swindling money, fighting punks, Cameron looking just the match for him, in that crazy number, when he swirls her around, and a number of other things, which keep you so focused, with it's marvelous editing, thoughtful script-writing, even though it's a comedy, and not to be taken seriously ! They have wasted a cute baby, a smart little doggy, and a disorganized, gullible father, a villainous character, and an indifferent mother ! There is hardly any chemistry amongst these characters on the screen, and some of the scenes like the baby pissing unstoppably, are hardly funny, more repulsive ! It's only towards the end, that the daddy removes his mask, to reveal his true face to the baby, and tells him, Look, I am your daddy, come to me, and the baby crawling back to him, when it had almost gone to the artful villain, who had lured it with colorful gimmicks, that you feel somewhat touched, though it's too late ! All in all, a huge disappointment, for those who enjoyed the First one, and expected similar, or even more enjoyment, and even for the others, who might not have seen it ! Isn't there any quality control, over these film makers, when they try and make a sequel, and ruin the beauty of the original ? Perhaps, even Jim's very presence might have saved the sequel from being such a disaster ! No wonder, it's forgotten, faster than it ran in the theaters ! Not even worth wasting money on buying DVD ! Too much colorful extravaganza, mindless copy, flat characters, lack of home work , is not adequate , to produce even a comedy, which hardly inspires any laughters !

reviews.review_title: A complete waste of time...
reviews.content: This movie is a complete joke...I can't believe some people have given this thing anything above a 1....it doesn't even rate that much!!! This crap is just plain insulting, even to kids. Those who say it is like a cartoon...it is a bit...but no fool would try to stretch a 3 minute Tweety bird cartoon to 90 minutes would they? Those cartoons had character...this has none...it is an insult not an homage to those great cartoons!!! Some one said it is "original"....how can it be? it is a sequel and all it does is try unsuccessfully to rip off cartoons...there is not a shred of originality here...it's horrible to watch!!! The acting is poor and the plot disjointed when there actually is one...case in point: very early on the "mother" in this is so keen to have a baby and her husband explain why he isn't ready, they both agree to wait...then straight away she gets pregnant and is happy, has the baby, then leaves on business...great Mother figure!!! It's like this was written by Monkeys!!! Only go see this if you hate yourself and want to waste your money and time...it's gonna clean up at next years' Rasberry Awards though...at this point in time I would give it a clean sweep!!! Avoid at all costs!!!

reviews.review_title: Unfunny
reviews.content: This film has nothing to do with the first one because it's an unfunny play suitable for children. The plot is not very beautiful and is more based on the fact that it is not understood why the child has the powers of the mask and the fact that Loky wants both the child and the mask, in the endthe ending is almost misplaced by the first.

reviews.review_title: Brilliant Cartoon Antics
reviews.content: CARTOON SPECIAL EFFECTS ANTICS RULE film review by Fred Topel Son of the Mask very smartly sets itself up as a different movie entirely from its predecessor. Instead of a superhero story, this is about what would happen if one fathered a child while under the spell of the mask. It's a fun, cute family movie that totally works on its own. People have this lofty memory of The Mask. Nobody seems to remember what a slow paced movie it was. Yeah, the scenes of Jim Carrey in greenface with cartoon effects were great, but there were only four of them. In between, there were long stretches of cliché plot about a repressed shy guy, a mean gangster and his hot girlfriend. There may be no Jim Carrey quality human antics in Son of the Mask, but it's much faster paced. You don't even get a chance to breathe. Jamie Kennedy is not playing Jim Carrey. When he puts on the mask, it's a much calmer type of green guy. He still has a few tricks, but he's not bouncing off the walls. He's more laid back. And he only wears it twice. He's really playing father, and the bulk of the movie is his heightened reactions to the kooky kid. He may overdo it and the fisheye lenses may be too much, but for a kids movie it's not offensive. He's just being a clown. Once the mask baby is born, it's nonstop chaos for poor father Tim Avery (Kennedy). Scenes of the baby and the mask-wearing dog enacting classic cartoon bits are brilliant. Some direct references to classic cartoons nail them perfectly, and original stuff maintains a consistent tone. The effects here are great. There's no hint of blur in all of the live action cartoonery. And of course, everything has to be bigger. The eyes don't just bug out, they go all the way across the room. To some extent, they try too hard sometimes (eyes bugging out a few feet is funnier than all the way across the room), but it all looks solid. The story of a playful man-boy learning responsibility may be as cliché as the good guy/bad guy story of the original, but it works better because of the relentless pace of all the mask-y stunts. You don't have time to think about the schmaltziness. Besides, the real story is simply the baby trying to drive Dad crazy, which is a very pure comedy premise. The idea of Loki and Odin's relationship playing out simultaneously to Tim and his son is clever and Alan Cumming sure knows how to sell special effects comedy. Connections to the original film include a return to Edge City, Ben Stein reprising his cameo and a snippet of the "Cuban Pete" song. They're nice nods to the original film, but really Son of the Mask could exist on its own. There are people who hate this movie with a passion and I just don't understand the point. If you don't like the jokes and think it's stupid, fine, but it's still just a harmless kid's movie. It doesn't have any offensive values or inappropriate tone or incompetent aspects. It services its audiences respectfully, it's not too dumb for kids because of all the classic cartoon references and it's well done.

reviews.review_title: Not related to The Mask at all
reviews.content: This movie has nothing to do with the original Movie. None of the original actors appeared in any way shape or form. The storyline is not related by anything. What is even worse is the fact that they include Odin and Loky. They make loky look like a cartoon just like the mask for no reason at all. If you have never seen the original you might find it funny for kids of 8 years or younger. But if you like the original you are goin to have a bad time.

reviews.review_title: Worse than 1994's 'The Mask' in every conceivable way
reviews.content: Just as awful as I had anticipated. With that said, it's nothing so bad that it offended me - it's simply totally and utterly bad, to the point I kinda find it hard to hate on it because I just don't have any thoughts on it. It is, without question, undoubtedly worse than 1994's 'The Mask' in every conceivable way though.Jamie Kennedy's version of this Dark Horse Comics character is truly dreadful, especially visually, though thankfully the film doesn't actually give that much air time to Kennedy as The Mask; like, he's there but it's predominantly the dog and the son that get much of the screen time alongside Alan Cumming's Loki - to slightly better effect too, the way the kid is animated kinda nearly works... it doesn't, but almost.Ryan Reynolds, according to Kennedy himself, possibly wanted this role. It's lucky Reynolds didn't get his way, or he'd be stuck with a green ghoul in his past. Oh, wait!4/10 is probably generous on my part, though there are far worse films out there that actually annoy me - 'Son of the Mask' honestly doesn't. It kinda just exists and I'm almost nonplussed about it.

reviews.review_title: Not to be confused with the original
reviews.content: "Son of the Mask" and "The Mask" should never be mentioned in the same conversation. Two totally different movies aimed at totally different audiences. I won't bother to compare the two, because that would really be impossible."Son of the Mask" is a silly, not very well developed kids film that has its share of terrific CGI. Yes, most of the best parts of the movie can be seen from the trailer. But there are still a few surprises that make it a good "family night" movie.The best part of the movie for me was Alan Cumming. He is very funny as the son of Odin, looking for his long lost mask. This was clearly the best written role in the film.Jamie Kennedy is okay in the lead role, although the character as written, is not exactly likable."Son of the Mask" is nothing more than it sets out to be, a simple somewhat enjoyable family film. I just don't understand why they budgeted $70 million to make it.

reviews.review_title: The Pointless Sequel To The Mask: A Review Of Son Of The Mask
reviews.content: It is common, especially for Hollywood, to churn out a sequel that is not as good as its original blockbuster. Watch the very weak Men in Black 2 to understand this completely in contrast to its witty sci-fi comedy of an original. However, after viewing such a flawed fantasy, I recommend this is how low you can go to make a horrible sequel! Choppy editing. The camera work was poor! You name a flaw in film-making and realise how many you can find in this doomed project. This is a visual guide how not to make film, unless of course you are a studio executive, who couldn't care less that such a film is bad, but a money-making venture for its franchise. As you cannot tell, I think this is how such a poor sequel was introduced.So, what did I hate about this film? Was it the fact that they tried to be more creative than its predecessor? Yes, by the bowl full! In the original they at least had someone who gave an "animated performance" to the main character, who pulls all sorts of codes and convention from the world of Hollywood animation. I am talking of no one but some Canadian comedian known as Jim Carrey, in a role I thought was suitable for his brand of goofy talents. However, viewing the Son of the Mask, they fail to impress me with such antics that I could not stand any more, and cringed for every time such an antic was performed.Was another reason the fact got anything to do with the plot of a struggling animator wanting his idea to become a show? Through that perspective, I guess not. But this sub-plot failed to make such a focus on the narrative of this film, instead they went to re-invent the antics that made The Mask entertaining, that I couldn't even care less about this animation-orientated sub-plot. Also, the fact is the film focuses on Poki trying to get that Mask back to his father was the main narrative. In fact, because of that narrative, the filmmakers, who I do not want to hear about unless they make something really worth watching, the excuse to proceed such badly-timed antics.While on the subject of the main narrative, I will have a moan about costumes; that god's outfit looked so cheap and nasty that I think an amateur drama society could make a better job than that piece of ghastly clothing.Also, while we are on the subject of the god, I found some dialogue either poorly written or badly acted. It was hard to tell. So I will blame both such a script that relied on the clichés of a family film to make the film have some continuity. Although from viewing this, I wished the writers had writer's block and go on to write something else. I will also put blame on some of the actors and actresses. Actually, I won't blame them; performing such rubbish deserves recognition, which will unfortunately be a Razzie Award. Well, the actor that played the god was terrible and so unknowingly, that I wish someone with much better acting training had the role. But I hope Brian Blessed will have turned down that role at such a sight of a poor project.There you go. I have survived watching such rubbish, and hopefully go on and have a better life, and hopefully forgetting that such a flawed film even existed. But they do say, with bad films, that it is so bad it's good. That will never apply to this pointless sequel to The Mask.

reviews.review_title: It's for children:)
reviews.content:
At the beginning you expect so much. Cause the main problem is Mask 2 can't challenge with The Mask with the magnificiant Jim Carey:)
Movie is absurd and baby is creepy as an adult. But my son likes the movie. Does not adraid of baby or dog. He watch the movie as a cartoon. Some of the scenes are very nice as pencil and sharpener scene.

reviews.review_title: This sequel to The Mask is not good... at all
reviews.content: This film was garbage. It's the sequel to the film The Mask, which is obviously way better than this one. This sequel had terrible jokes, poor acting and too many plot holes!Tim Avery, an aspiring cartoonist has his life flipped when his dog, Otis, brings home the magic mask of Loki. Loki's infuriated father, Odin, orders Loki to take back what's his, one way or another. The film stars Jamie Kennedy. He did a very poor job playing the role of Tim Avery. In the first film, The Mask, the protagonist was Stanley Ipkiss, played by the hilarious Jim Carrey and with this one, Tim Avery was the protagonist. I don't get that. Why not use Jim Carrey again? He's far better than Jamie. The director, Lawrence Guterman ruined a great movie with this crap follow up! Then there's Tim's wife Tonya, who also did a bad job acting, but hey, she did a better job than Jamie.This movie is terrible, and no one should have to see it. Well, at least it wasn't as bad as King's Ransom. I watched this movie once or twice, and I will not be watching it again! The best way to enjoy this movie is not to see it in the first place.

reviews.review_title: I can say one amazing thing about this movie- it was an 80 million dollar prank
reviews.content: This movie isn't very good. The jokes have no originality at all, they're either dull as hell, or taken directly from an old cartoon and poorly executed. The plot is basically just that Tim Avery is a cartoonist with nothing to do with his life. Then the mask just happens to float into Fringe city *Error, the dog from the first movie got the mask, so how did it float somewhere else?* Then Tim gets ahold of the mask and puts it on. When he gets home, he leaves the mask on and conceives a child. Big mistake, the child has the powers of the mask now. Meanwhile, Loki, the owner of the mask is in deep s**t with his father, Odin, because he let the mask fall into mortal hands. Now he has to find a baby and take it too.The movie isn't very funny, and the special effects are awful, the first movies special effects are 10 years more advanced, pretty bad for a movie made 10 years after. I can credit one thing to this movie, Jamie Kennedy made this movie as an 80 million dollar prank for a special on his show. I don't think anyones ever spent so much money on a prank.

reviews.review_title: Just for the sake of...
reviews.content: CURIOSITY.Yes, the main reason why most people watch these movies.AND, of course, for the expectations left by it's predecessors. In this case, THE MASK, starring Jim carrey. Although his characters can sometimes be excessive and theatrical, carrey gives us a much better performance in his movie than Jamie kennedy.Kennedy takes some time to warm up to his character, never staying far from a mild/average acting skill, thus, never really making a connection with the audience.Now, Bob Hoskins steals the show, as far as i'm concerned. Quite good as ODIN, father of the gods.Surprisingly, from my point of view, what could be the highlight of the show, the FX/digitally animated scenes/action between the dog and the baby that gives the name to the movie - the son of the mask - and all the other digital animations in the movie, are what actually spoils it. Some parts are all too excessive and boring , showing some abuse in the use of CGI effects. Or the lack of imagination and plagiarism ( as when the dog, that looks rather like ipkiss's dog, puts on and changes into the mask, like in the previous movie).Alan Cumming is pleasant , sometimes a bit annoying in his matrix stile wearing.All in all, if i were to choose, i would go for a whole digitally animated movie like the breakthrough one's these days, and far better. That would certainly be a better choice, probably a winning one. This is not the case though, a mild movie dangerously in the border of average and bad, but still, manages not to fall down completely. 5 out 10

reviews.review_title: Well, if you ever need a cure for insomnia...
reviews.content: ...then this is it. This is forced comedy at it's worst, as for 90 minutes, many things that are not funny happen. There is absolutely no sign of the gag-fest of the original Mask, which rightly put Carrey into mainstream cinema. Jamie Kennedy as main character has no charisma whatsoever and simply looks depressed when he becomes the Mask. Cumming (Loki) just looks a poof throughout.The ending is nothing that anyone with the IQ of the average 3 year old can figure out. Instead, the real story is the battle between Cumming and Kennedy to bore as many people as possible, both on and off the screen. Carrey grinned like a maniac as the Mask; Kennedy just gimmaces. Just look at the expression on everybody's faces in his vicinity both as Avery and as the Mask. Utter boredom. Cumming has the best part (not that there's much competition - he should have played Avery) but in his opening scene he simply uses his mighty powers of boredom to outwit his foe. His magnum opus for boredom takes place in a busy street in broad daylight where he's flexing his mighty computer-generated powers and is ignored by everyone.Good bits? Well, I gave this two stars as I think this movie is unique in that most of the budget went on the splendid spangily cheery props and scenery than on the cheap, bland and wooden actors. But despite all the flashy effects, I imagine that anybody watching this dull-fest masquerading as entertainment to the end will be left feeling depressed, thoroughly miserable, heartless, soul-less and sickly-green with nausea. Give them an orange plastic wig to wear and it will be Son of the Mask all over again. Avoid.

reviews.review_title: Am I disappointed because it wasn't as bad as everyone says?
reviews.content: I was actually scared to watch this movie because I expected it would be one of those movies that is so bad it makes you want to bang your head to the wall. But it wasn't like that after all. Very silly, yes, but not boring. It was watchable, though I don't want to watch it again anytime soon (or ever?). The first half was quite good good but then came the scenes with the cgi baby and cgi dog running all around the house so fast you can't even see what's happening. That was boring, yes, because it was just a mess. Towards the end it got a bit better again.Overall: not as bad as everyone says. Just slightly bad, but not very bad. That is my rating. Not recommended to watch...but if you feel like you want to see it, go ahead!

reviews.review_title: Not brilliant, but good clean fun.
reviews.content: This film might not be everyones cup of tea. However, I feel that the reason it was made, is the reason it will be enjoyed. Its for kids!I didn't really enjoy it, but anyone under the age of 10 will love it.Anyone under the age of 7 will find it hilarious!All in all, its a good clean movie, which is good fun, and nice and short, so you can take your kids in, and they'll have a nice couple of hours out at the cinema.The film is a good looking movie. The style in which its shot is nice and crisp. The colours are vibrant, which is great for kids!Some of the effects are dodgy, especially some of the baby sequences, but they've got the dog down to a tee!Although Jamie Kennedy is trying to be Jim Carey in this movie, and even though in your mind, your seeing how hard hes trying. Your kids won't!Don't take the film seriously, and watch kids reactions, as they leave the cinema. Trust me, they'll enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: Maybe the worst movie I have ever saw.
reviews.content: First of all I have to tell you that my review do not contains any spoilers because simply there is not a plot in the movie.So , let's start by telling you the "plot" :a baby is born by the mask and wants to send its father to the asylum because he(yes it is a boy)saw it on television.The dog of the family wears the mask and is trying to save the dad and kill the baby.Does this "plot" reminds you something ? I don't know about you but it reminds one of the hundreds of movies in which some people chasing it even looks like tom & jerry in which tom is after jerry but jerry is always saved.About the effects , I am not a professional designer but I could even create them , they are so fake.The actors are really bad and they remind me all the time that its a movie , I just do not forget it.So if you are at home and you want to see a movie do not buy or even rent this movie.You will lose some minutes of your life , and I say minutes because I just couldn't finish this movie but I can guess the end .Although I won't tell you it because it is amazing(That was just a joke , I know it's not funny but at least it is better than the jokes in this movie).

reviews.review_title: All sizzle, nooooo steak.
reviews.content: Having nearly no continuity or connection to the first film, Jamie Kennedy plays Tim Avery, an under-appreciated loser who desperately wants to make it as an animator. So when an unexpected bundle of joy comes along, he gets more than he bargained for... oh god. Cheesy premise, yes, but is it watchable? There are only two reasons this movie was made. One: Money. (duh.) Two: an exercise in animation techniques and physical effects. Like those straight-to-tape Disney sequels, this movie strikes me as "practise" for animators and animation techniques. That said, the different animations and computer graphics throughout the movie are very good and are amalgamated with the live action fairly well. However, besides that and the surprising heartfelt 'message' near the end of the movie, the good stuff pretty much ends there.Jim Carrey MADE the original movie. Now Jamie Kennedy has shown his versatility behind a disguise on 'The Jamie Kennedy Experiment', yet he seemed really restricted and NON-wild in his subpar prosthetics. Sadly, even a decent performance from super talented Alan Cumming couldn't really help a script that really seems to go all over the place. Add to all this a CG animated baby that "doesn't quite look right" and you have yet another shallow attempt to cash in on a surprisingly profitable original.Is "Son Of The Mask" worth watching for the average viewer? I don't think so. Is this harmless family viewing? Mostly. But if you're an animation buff like I am and grew up on those Tex Avery-type cartoons, you MIGHT be able to appreciate this movie for that aspect. 2 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: The Movie Sucks
reviews.content: I'll Give you an advice , please don't buy this movie or go to the theater to watch it , it's not worthy to watch it either. Man , the original movie was better than this.When I watched , I felt like I'm an a$$hole and sucker too. this is ridiculous . I don't know what the directer and producer thinks when they made this movie , is it to make fun of the audience or just to make fun of the original movie or just they want to make fun of themselves.I recommended that you are an a$$hole if you just think for a moment that you'll buy it or your gonna watch it.

reviews.review_title: Dreadful
reviews.content: Thank goodness I didn't pay any money to see this flick. Let's start off by saying that I had low expectations for this film to begin with. By the time I was 20 minutes into it, I was bored out of my mind. When Tim Avery put on the mask, I thought, hmmm... I wonder what this is gonna be like. It was not in the least bit funny, the humor was terribly dry. Then the animated baby and the dog. Didn't even get a chuckle out of me. I love cartoons, but movies that try to be cartoons better do it amazingly well, which this movie fails to do. The toilet humor was not at all funny either, and I'm a big fan of Terrance and Phillip. The only performance that was acceptable was by Alan Cumming playing Loki. Bob Hoskins as Odin was just laughable. For some reason he feels the need to yell every line, and he does not come across as Godlike. Consider yourself warned, don't watch this!

reviews.review_title: Awful please don't do it again!!!
